name: ArrayList
description:
Writing my own class for arrays was one of my worst ideas...

An ArrayList stores a variable number of objects. This is similar to making an array of objects, but with an ArrayList, items can be easily added and removed from the ArrayList and it is resized dynamically. This can be very convenient, but it's slower than making an array of objects when using many elements.

functions.name: clear
functions.description: Clears the array

functions.name: reverse
functions.description: Reverses the order of the elements in the ArrayList. The array will be modified!

functions.name: getSize
functions.description: The size/count of the stored objects.

functions.name: isEmpty
functions.description: checks to see if the Vector has any elements.

functions.name: last
functions.description: return the last element.

functions.name: asArray
functions.description: Return a reference to the internal javascript native array.

functions.name: first
functions.description: returns the first element

functions.name: get
functions.description: returns an element at a specified index

functions.name: add
functions.description: Adds a element at the end of the Vector.

functions.name: grep
functions.description: The method removes items from an array as necessary so that all remaining items pass a provided test. The test is a function that is passed an array item and the index of the item within the array. Only if the test returns true will the item stay in the array.

functions.name: find
functions.description:
Return ONE element which matches by the given function or null if no element is found.

var r1= figures.find(function(figure){ return figure.id===123456 });

functions.name: map
functions.description:
Translate all items in the array into new items. The array list is modified after this call. You must clone the array before if you want avoid this.

var labels = this.commands.clone().map(function(e){ return e.getLabel(); });

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: The function to process each item against. The first argument to the function is the value; the second argument is the index or key of the array or object property.

functions.name: unique
functions.description: Removes any duplicate elements from the array. The array is modified after this call. You must clone the array before if you want avoid this

functions.name: addAll
functions.description: Add all elements into this array.

parameters.name: avoidDuplicates
parameters.description: checks whenever the new elements exists before insert if the parameter is to [true]

functions.name: pop
functions.description: You can use the Array list as Stack as well. this is the pop method to remove one element at the end of the stack.

functions.name: push
functions.description: Push one element at the top of the stack/array

functions.name: remove
functions.description: Remove the element from the list

functions.name: insertElementAt
functions.description: Inserts an element at a given position. Existing elements will be shifted to the right.

functions.name: removeElementAt
functions.description: Removes an element at a specific index.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: the index of the element to remove

functions.name: removeAll
functions.description: removes all given elements in the ArrayList

functions.name: indexOf
functions.description: Return the zero based index of the given element or -1 if the element not in the list.

functions.name: contains
functions.description: returns true if the element is in the Vector, otherwise false.

functions.name: sort
functions.description: Sorts the collection based on a field name or sort a function. See on http://www.w3schools.com/jsref/jsref_sort.asp if you use a sort function.

parameters.name: f
parameters.description: the field name for the sorting or a sort function

functions.name: clone
functions.description: Copies the contents of a Vector to another Vector returning the new Vector.

parameters.name: deep
parameters.description: call "clone" of each elements and add the clone to the new ArrayList

functions.name: each
functions.description: Iterates over the list of elements, yielding each in turn to an iterator function. Each invocation of iterator is called with two arguments: (index, element).

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: the callback function to call for each element

parameters.name: reverse
parameters.description: optional parameter. Iterate the collection reverse if it set to true

functions.name: setPersistentAttributes
functions.description: Read all attributes from the serialized properties and transfer them into the shape.
